critique: The document focuses on transferring responsibility and ensuring efficiency and security in background investigations. The primary emotions the President likely wants to elicit are confidence in the government's ability to protect sensitive information and a sense of order and control. There's also an element of reassurance that this transition will be smooth and well-managed. The language is formal and procedural, aiming for a sense of competence and reliability. There is little to suggest any strong emotions such as anger, fear, or disgust. Surprise is also unlikely, as the order seems to be a planned and deliberate action.
